summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2008 VOLKSWAGEN TOUAREG. WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED IN THE GARAGE, A STRONG FUEL ODOR WAS NOTICED INSIDE AND AROUND THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER (ROYAL VOLKSWAGEN, LOCATED AT 3010 COLUMBIANA RD, BIRMINGHAM, AL 35216) WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE FUEL FILTER FLANGE DETACHED AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE DEALER STATED THAT THE CONTACT WOULD NEED TO PAY OUT OF POCKET FOR THE REPAIR. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED DUE TO THE REPAIR FEE. THE CONTACT RECEIVED A RECALL NOTIFICATION FOR NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 17V151000 (FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE); HOWEVER, THE PART NEEDED FOR THE REPAIR WAS NOT AVAILABLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE AND INFORMED THE CONTACT THAT HE HAD TO PAID OUT OF POCKET AND WOULD POSSIBLY BE REIMBURSED. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 87,000. VIN TOOLS CONFIRMS PARTS NOT AVAILABLE.
